title: JSON Resume
description: A standard JSON format for resume data.

importance.description: A rating of how important this item is, starting at 0 as the least important.

image.description: A picture of you. Must be a URL (as per RFC 3986) to a image in JPEG or PNG format.

phone.description: Your phone number. Phone numbers are stored as strings so use any format you like, e.g. 712-117-2923.

url.description: A URL (as per RFC 3986) to your website, such as your personal homepage or portfolio.

summary.description: A short (2-3 sentence) biography about yourself.

address.description: The street address of your current residence. To add multiple address lines, use \n. For example, 1234 Glücklichkeit Straße\nHinterhaus 5. Etage li.

postalCode.description: The postal code of your current residence (e.g. 22181).

city.description: The city of your current residence (e.g. Vienna).

countryCode.description: The country of your current residence. This should be a code as per ISO-3166-1 ALPHA-2, e.g. US, AU, IN.

region.description: The general region in which you live, such as a US state or province.

network.description: The name of the network (e.g. Facebook or Twitter).

username.description: Your username or handle on the network (e.g. neutralthoughts).

url.description: A URL to your profile on the network (e.g. https://twitter.com/neutralthoughts).

allOf.description: A job or other work experience.

name.description: The name of the company where you worked (e.g. Facebook).

location.description: The location of the job or of the company headquarters, as appropriate (e.g. Menlo Park, CA).

description.description: A brief description of the company (e.g. Social Media Company).

position.description: Your position while at the job (e.g. Software Engineer).

url.description: A URL to the company's website or another relevant page (e.g. https://facebook.com).

startDate.description: The date on which you started the job, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2014-06-29).

endDate.description: The date on which you ended the job, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2012-06-29). Omit this property if the job is ongoing.

summary.description: An overview of your responsibilities at the company.

highlights.description: A list of highlights for the job, such as accomplishments or responsibilities.

items.description: A job highlight (e.g. Increased profits by 20% from 2011-2012 through viral advertising).

allOf.description: A volunteer position or other volunteer opportunity.

organization.description: The name of the organization at which you volunteered (e.g. UNICEF).

position.description: Your position as a volunteer (e.g. Software Engineer).

url.description: A URL to the organization's website or another relevant page (e.g. https://unicef.org).

startDate.description: The date on which you started the volunteer position, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2014-06-29).

endDate.description: The date on which you ended the volunteer position, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2012-06-29). Omit this property if the position is ongoing.

summary.description: An overview of your responsibilities at the organization.

highlights.description: A list of highlights for the volunteer position, such as accomplishments or responsibilities.

items.description: A position highlight (e.g. Engineered a new marketing platform, increasing donations by 20%).

allOf.description: A degree, school or other educational experience.

institution.description: The institution you attended (e.g. Massachusetts Institute of Technology).

area.description: The area of your degree (e.g. Arts).

studyType.description: The type of degree you received (e.g. Bachelor).

startDate.description: The date on which you started the education, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2012-04-29).

endDate.description: The date on which you completed the education, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2012-04-29). Omit this property if the education is ongoing.

courses.description: A list of notable courses and subjects which you took.

items.description: The title of the course or subject (e.g. H1302 - Introduction to American history).

title.description: The title of the award (e.g. One of the 100 greatest minds of the century).

date.description: The date on which you received the award, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 1989-06-12).

awarder.description: The organization that presented the award (e.g. Time Magazine).

summary.description: A brief summary of why you received the award (e.g. Received for my work with Quantum Physics).

allOf.description: A publication, such as a journal or newspaper article.

name.description: The name of the publication (e.g. The World Wide Web).

publisher.description: The name of the publisher (e.g. IEEE, Computer Magazine).

releaseDate.description: The date on which this publication was released, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 1990-08-01).

url.description: A URL to the publication or another relevant page (e.g. http://www.computer.org.example.com/csdl/mags/co/1996/10/rx069-abs.html).

summary.description: A short summary of publication (e.g. Discussion of the World Wide Web, HTTP, HTML).

name.description: The name of the skill (e.g. Web Development).

level.description: Your level of proficiency in the skill (e.g. Master).

keywords.description: A list of keywords pertaining to this skill.

language.description: The name of the language (e.g. English, Spanish).

fluency.description: Your proficiency in the language (e.g. Fluent, Beginner).

name.description: The name or subject of the interest (e.g. Philosophy).

keywords.description: A list of keywords relating to the interest.

name.description: The name of the individual giving the reference (e.g. Timothy Cook).

reference.description: A brief testamonial from the individual (e.g. Joe blogs was a great employee, who turned up to work at least once a week. He exceeded my expectations when it came to doing nothing.).

allOf.description: A project on which you worked, potentially as part of some other experience.

name.description: The name of the project (e.g. The World Wide Web).

description.description: A short summary of the project (e.g. Collated works of 2017).

highlights.description: A list of highlights of the project, such as what you accomplished or created.

items.description: A single highlight (e.g. Directs you close but not quite there).

keywords.description: A list of keywords relating to the project.

startDate.description: The date on which you started the project, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2012-04-29).

endDate.description: The date on which you completed the project, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. 2012-06-29). Omit this property if the project is ongoing.

url.description: A URL to the project website or another relevant page (e.g. http://www.computer.org/csdl/mags/co/1996/10/rx069-abs.html).

roles.description: A list of your roles on this project or in the organization behind it.

items.description: A single role (e.g. Team Lead, Speaker, Writer).

entity.description: The company or other entity with which this project was affiliated (e.g. GNU).

type.description: The type of this project (e.g. volunteering, presentation, talk, application, conference).

meta.description: Information about the schema version or other tooling configuration.

canonical.description: The URL (as per RFC 3986) to the latest version of this document.

version.description: A version field which follows semantic versioning (e.g. v1.0.0).

lastModified.description: The date on which this document was last modified, in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss).

publications.description: Publications that you have authored or to which you have contributed.

languages.description: The languages that you speak or with which you have some familiarity.

projects.description: Projects on which you worked, either as part of a job or independently.
